intro: Vermeulenia cyrenaica, commonly known as the Cyrenaica vermeulenia, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its delicate, feathery leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
